title: Sunday Wine Down - Spain
content:
THIS OCTOBER, SUNDAY WINE DOWN SOJOURNS IN SPAIN!
Explore an exciting array of whites, reds & bubbles stretching from the cool North Atlantic to the island paradise of Mallorca. Vamos!

Sunday Wine Down is our monthly walkabout wine tasting event where you're invited to try a curated selection showcasing the best and brightest bottles from our wine lists and retail store. It's a relaxed and social setting where you can experience great wines and friendly pricing.

title: Flex Your Creativity with Preserved Moss Frame
content: Are you someone who loves greenery but do not have the time to upkeep it regularly? In this course, let your creative juices flow by crafting a personalised preserved moss frame. It’s also maintenance-free, perfect for your everyday living spaces!

title: Full Moon in Aries Healing Circle 2022
content:
Presenting brand-new, fortnightly New Moon & Full Moon Healing Circles!

These are Universal, non-religious, Spiritual Wellness workshops accessible to anyone, providing a safe space to heal, share, and grow!

Full moons are a great time for releasing blocks, discovering solutions, and amplifying your energies!

The Aries full moon is best for healing:

- Issues surrounding the head and face
- Challenges involving self-identity, self-image, self-worth, and self-acceptance
- Anger, impulsivity, and their related effects
- Leadership and inner warrior themes
- Divine Masculine matters
- Anything blocking your drive, energy, and initiative to do what you must!

So if you have an Aries anywhere in your chart, need to work on these issues, or just love all things New Age and Spiritual… come join in this Full Moon Healing Circle!

What you will need to do:

- Dress comfortably.
- Bring a shawl or sweater should you get cold.
- Bring a bottle of water along should you get thirsty
- Come with an open and honest state of mind

So spread the word, bring your friends along, and let’s heal with the Full Moon in Aries!

Date: Sunday, 9 Oct 2022, 5:15pm – 6:45pm
Venue: 34 Upper Weld Road, #02-01, Singapore 207391
(3 min walk from Jalan Besar MRT Exit B)
(4 min walk from Rochor MRT Exit B)
RSVP to Ashoka @ +65 9689 2610
Suggested donation of $22 or more
(Google Pay, PayNow, PayLah!, Bank Transfer and Cash are accepted at the event)

About Ashoka:
Ashoka is a Singapore-based, International Holistic Practitioner in the fields of Wellness, Spirituality, New Age & Metaphysics. He is also an Usui Reiki Healer, Akashic Records Consultant, Angel Intuitive, Tibetan Mantra Healing Practitioner, and a Munay-Ki Initiate/Instructor. For more on Ashoka and his work, please visit www.AshokaHealing.com

title: The Limitless Run 2022
content:
With the large increase in young adults seeking mental health support and treatment, LIMITLESS lends a listening ear to those who need it the most by reaching out to teenagers from all walks of life and helping them understand the power within themselves to overcome the struggles that they face.

LIMITLESS holds an annual virtual run, where they raise funds to support their work for the following year. By participating, you will be helping LIMITLESS fund the increased costs required to meet the growing need for their services and enable them to expand their clinical team to provide for the increase. This will in turn allow them to help more youths who need mental health therapy.

Participants will need to clock distances ranging from 5km to 100km within the run period of three weeks, and will also be encouraged to help raise funds to support their work! All participants are encouraged to use a running app to track and record their time and distance, and will be able to receive a finisher’s medal after verification.

All participants will also be entitled to a race pack!

The LIMITLESS Run - RUN FOR HOPE 2022 will be held between 10 - 31 October 2022.

Join the run!

title: From Then To Now: Capturing Life
content:
There is perhaps no other artist who works as hard as Mr. Lim Tze Peng, widely known as Singapore’s oldest artist. Lee will be unveiling fifty of his works in his latest solo exhibition titled From Then To Now: Capturing Life which will run from 11 October to 25 November 2022.

Guest-of-Honour, Mr Edwin Tong, Minister for Culture, Community and Youth and Second Minister for Law, will grace the launch of the exhibition on 11 October to celebrate Lim Tze Peng’s 50 exclusive works, unveiled for the first time in Ode to Art Gallery.

At his age, Lee continues to paint daily, bringing us scenes of Singapore’s yesteryears using his favourite medium of ink and rice paper. Open to public from 12 October onwards, viewers are invited to immerse themselves in Lim Tze Peng’s works, with highlights such as paintings that were painted in the 1970-1980s and newly-recoloured in the last two years, bringing his memories of Singapore’s yesteryears to life and a stark reminder of how far the nation has come in a mere 57 years since its independence.

Other tales of Singapore through imageries of everyday scenes across the decades like Chinatown, Singapore River, old kampung life, and still life will be on display as well.

title: Chope Buffet-licious 2022
content: Singaporeans’ all-time favourite buffet sale is back and bigger than ever! Chope Buffet-licious features an unrivalled selection of buffet deals, with epic discounts of up to 50% off, 1-for-1s and more! Till 31 October, enjoy an extra $6 off when you checkout with DBS PayLah! Get ready to stock up on your favourites!

title: The Marmalade Pantry Unveils Pop-Up by Madly Gems
content:
The Marmalade Pantry unveils a special collaboration with Madly Bespoke Jeweler, Singapore’s only fine jewellery design house specialising in coloured gems. The harmonious pairing of the two homegrown brands amalgamates in an immersive and multi-sensory The Marmalade Pantry x Madly pop-up, available exclusively from 11 October to 10 November 2022 at the bistro’s flagship Ion Orchard outlet in the heart of Singapore’s shopping precinct.

Founded in 2014 by Maddy Barber, Madly ethically sources for the world’s top 0.1% of coloured gemstones from all over the world. Gem education and the bespoke process have always been placed at the forefront of their experience. At the pop-up, Madly will transport its ‘Lapidarist in Action’ experiential zone from the Brand Experience Centre to The Marmalade Pantry. Diners can observe a virtual lapidarist at work to appreciate the intricacies behind this craft and art form.

Inspired by Madly’s dazzling gemstones, The Marmalade Pantry has specially curated an exclusive Bejewelled Afternoon Tea Set* ($78++ for two persons), highlighting a resplendent collection of specially curated gem-themed sweets and savouries such as the Beryl Panna Cotta Shooter, Geode Cupcake, Garnet Buttermilk Scones, Spinel Tartlet, and Ruby Bruschetta; in addition to perennial favourites.

Diners are invited to scan a QR code on the cake topper to find out more about the gemstones that inspired this delectable afternoon indulgence, and for this exclusive period only, a Madly gem loupe is complimentary with the first 50 Bejewelled Afternoon Tea Sets ordered.

*The Bejewelled Afternoon Tea Set is available for dine-in at the Ion Orchard outlet from 2pm to 6pm from Monday to Thursday.

title: Win The Future Youth Camp
content:
This October let your child win the future with EduCare4u’s Youth Camp! This year’s camp is lined up with exciting activities to foster a holistic development in children.

From critical future skills to help students excel in their academics to important understanding of impactful technologies of the future, this camp is planned based on a holistic approach to take care of every child's interest.

This year’s camp is also in partnership with AIBI, the market leader and trendsetter in fitness, to bring fitness programmes to the participants.

Interested parents and participants can take advantage of our early bird promotion, which is priced at S$699. The early bird promotion ends on 2 October 2022.

Your child will not go home empty-handed; instead, he or she will receive a certificate upon completion of the modules covered during the camp. Additionally, the first 25 sign ups will receive a limited free physical certificate, certifying the future-readiness of the child.

Interested participants can contact (+65) 9128-9115.

title: My Safe Place Concert
content:
The ‘My Safe Place Concert’ is a charity concert organised to celebrate the release of the EP as well as to raise funds for the beneficiaries of the cause. The concert features 5 Filipina and Singapore artists including singer-songwriters, Trisha Denise, LU.ME, KIRI, kotoji and Marian Carmel, all with the aim of creating and embracing music as means to find comfort and to help themselves in times of difficulty and need - to create a safe place.

Working with Singapore Street Festival, a portion of the ticket sales proceeds will contribute to their upcoming mental health projects.

title: Managing Emergencies at Home
content:
Does applying condensed milk on a burn help? Will you heal faster by applying toothpaste on an insect bite? Have you ever faced an emergency at home and are at a lost?

Join Family Physicians, Dr S A Aziz Noordin and Dr Ng Huiyu, as they explore ways to manage common household emergencies such as cuts, insect bites, or allergies, as well as how to prevent and manage falls among the elderly!

Disclaimer: All content and advice shared during the programme are for informational purposes only. It is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

This programme is suitable for those aged 50 and above and organised in collaboration with Changi General Hospital.

title: How Well Do You Know Your Mental Health
content:
In conjunction with World Mental Health Day, nEbO, a junior membership arm of NTUC will be organising Mental Health Campaign from 10 – 15 October. As part of the overarching programme, nEbO will be having a YouTube live dialogue on 14 October, to share and discuss important mental health practices for youths who are transitioning from student to young working adults.

The speaker list is as follows:
- Mr Asher Low, Founder of Limitless Singapore
- Dr Tammy Tsang, Consultant from the Psychiatry Department of Sengkang General Hospital
- Judy, Yuki, and Puja, Founders of PeacePod

title: Comedy Live! Feat. Qam At The Lemon Stand
content:
The Lemon Stand Comedy Club is excited to bring you Singaporean Comedian, Qam as he headlines at Singapore's newest comedy venue in a Hilarious Stand Up Comedy Headline. Qam is joined by 6 Comics during each of his headlining shows so you can discover more amazing comedians in Singapore!

The Lemon Stand provides a full bar of drinks, free popcorn for each table and a food menu of bits and bites which you can find on our website.

At The Lemon Stand we do our best to bring together the comedic arts and the community with an entire venue created just for Comedy in Singapore so we hope you come out and enjoy your night with lots of laughs and entertainment!

title: ART:DIS Open House 2022
content:
A tentative stroke, step, sketch or song can blossom at ART:DIS. Your child can experience what it’s like to learn in an inclusive and safe space at our Open House. Conducted by instructors with years of experience in teaching students with differentiated learning needs, children can participate in workshops or make art with friends. We welcome one and all to share in our joy of the arts.

ART:DIS (Singapore) Ltd, formerly known as Very Special Arts Singapore, is a leading charity dedicated to creating learning and livelihood opportunities for persons with disabilities in the arts. Started in 1993, ART:DIS continues the hard work and sacrifices made by our stakeholders to organise art programmes, workshops, projects, collaborations, exhibitions and performances for persons with disabilities to reach for excellence and be relevant in the future.

title: BBC Earth Screening Festival
content: Gather your family and friends and join us at the BBC Earth Screening Festival on Saturday 15 October 2022, at 5.30pm where Frozen Planet II, narrated by Sir David Attenborough will take centre stage! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to watch this stunning BBC Earth documentary on a big screen under the stars at Gardens by the Bay. Frozen Planet II is a six-part series exploring the spellbinding journey through the magical icy lands that cover a quarter of our planet, and an episode will feature at the Screening Festival. Executive Producer of Frozen Planet II Mark Brownlow will take audiences behind the scenes from the show, unravelling the joys and challenges of filming the series. Alongside the screening, there will be fun-filled activities and special features for everyone. Join us for a spectacular evening amidst the lush greenery of Gardens By The Bay!

title: Cosfest 2022: The Dreams of A Million Stars
content:
Cosfest 2022 is returning to Downtown East on October 15 and 16 this year. Prep yourself for exhilarating stage performances including singing, anime and cosplay dance performances starring popular international cosplayers - kawaii Neneko, well-known Taiwanese celebrity cosplayer, and charismatic DJ cosplayer Joo A, from South Korea. There are also fringe activities throughout the weekend affair including trading card tournaments, graffiti wall and photo-ops.

Anime fans can expect more than 100 booths at this year’s Cosfest by international exhibitors and local creators, showcasing official merchandise as well as their anime art pieces and creations.

title: Join us to know more about OBESITY
content:
CONTENT OVERVIEW:

Complimentary 10-min Myofascial Therapy by Multiflora TCM Spa

Have you got Obesity figured out? Obesity is not just about eating less and exercising more.

Recent studies have shown that there is an increasing prevalence of obesity in Singapore, with obesity, including among children and adolescents, having increased tenfold over the past 40 years.
- What is obesity?
- What causes it, and what are the risk factors?
- When can you take action into your own hands, and when will you need to see a doctor?

Join us as we address the root causes of obesity, its various impacts, and how best to address such issues

SPEAKER:

Dr Sue Ho MB BCh BAO, Ireland
Senior Executive Doctor SL Aesthetic Clinic

Having honed her medical and surgical skills in Ireland and across the straits, Dr Sue started her medical practice in various public hospitals in Singapore. Sue’s passion for aesthetics was sparked by a chance encounter with Dr Chua, founder and medical director of SL Aesthetic Clinic. Sue is committed to enhancing the natural beauty of each patient, through a personalised and holistic program of treatment and care. Botox treatments, filler augmentation and skin rejuvenation are some of the minimally invasive procedures Sue is interested in. She is also an advocate for active living, often giving patients tips and insights to leading a healthier, more wholesome lifestyle. As a mother herself, Sue relates well to other mothers and the issues they face. Other than facial aesthetic treatments, she often performs feminine health treatments such as Fotona IntimaLase and IncontiLase
